intro: Celmisia cockayneana, commonly known as the Stewart Island celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded areas of the forest understorey, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its flowers are clustered in a rounded inflorescence. Celmisia cockayneana is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution primarily on Stewart Island.
